channel.title: AppleSilicon on Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration
channel.description: Recent content in AppleSilicon on Malware Analysis: Or How I Learned To Love Frustration

item.title: Great resources for starting out in malware reverse engineering
item.description: A list of resources for people looking to start their adventure into the wonderful world of malware reverse engineering. This list will be dynamically updated as and when I can evaluate new training material (both paid and free) available on the market.

item.title: The difference between Dynamic and Static analysis
item.description: Explaining the fundamental differences in dynamic and static analysis in reverse engineering malware samples across Windows, Mac and Nix endpoints.

item.title: [Part 2] Creating a safe (and functional) RE environment on Apple Silicon - UTM
item.description: This blog post will guide you through the key programs and downloads required to successfully set up a functional and safe malware environment on M series MacBooks using UTM.

item.title: [Part 1] Creating a safe (and functional) RE environment on Apple Silicon - VMWare Fusion
item.description: This blog post will guide you through the key programs and downloads required to successfully set up a functional and safe malware environment on M series MacBooks using VMWare Fusion.
